intro: Wahlenbergia californica, commonly known as the California larkspur, is a flowering plant native to California and Baja California. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its spikes of blue, purple, or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, showy blooms throughout the spring and summer. Wahlenbergia californica is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
